Description: Lower body and conical foot sherd of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style patterned, pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black with reserved dot in centre of bowl; exterior: slip partly worn; reserved on bowl; glazed streaky black on foot: underside: trace of white slip; inscription on underside.
Curator's comments: For parallels regarding squat patterned chalices, see Lemos no. 1062 from Kamiros.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXIV, no. 436)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 673, no. 317)
Johnston 2006a / Trademarks on Greek Vases: Addenda (p. 170, no. 38)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0960) (phase 2)
